import Mathlib

open Set Function Filter Topology Polynomial Real

/--
For all $x > e^e$, let $S = u_0, u_1, \dots$ be a recursively defined sequence with $u_0 = e$ and $u_{n+1} = \log_{u_n} x$ for all $n \ge 0$. Prove that $S_x$ converges to some real number $g(x)$ and that this function $g$ is continuous for $x > e^e$.
-/
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T := by
  intro x hx h
  have h₁ := h.1
  have h₂ := h.2
  have h₃ := h₂ x hx
  have h₄ : ∀ x ∈ T, ContinuousOn g T := by
    intro x hx
    have h₅ : ∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L) := h₁
    have h₆ : Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x)) := h₂ x hx
    exact continuousOn_const
  exact h₄ x hx
```

```lean4
import Mathlib

open Set Function Filter Topology Polynomial Real

/--
For all $x > e^e$, let $S = u_0, u_1, \dots$ be a recursively defined sequence with $u_0 = e$ and $u_{n+1} = \log_{u_n} x$ for all $n \ge 0$. Prove that $S_x$ converges to some real number $g(x)$ and that this function $g$ is continuous for $x > e^e$.
-/
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T := by
  intro x hx h
  have h₁ := h.1
  have h₂ := h.2
  have h₃ := hx
  have h₄ := hT
  have h₅ := hS x hx
  have h₆ := h₂ x hx
  have h₇ := h₅
  have h₈ := h₆
  have h₉ := h₁
  -- We need to show that g is continuous on T.
  -- Since T is the set of all x > exp(exp(1)), we can use the properties of the sequence S and the fact that g(x) is the limit of S(x) to show continuity.
  have h₁₀ : ContinuousOn g T := by
    apply continuousOn_iff_continuous_restrict.mpr
    have h₁₁ : Continuous g := by
      -- We use the fact that the limit of S(x) as n → ∞ exists and is equal to g(x) for all x ∈ T.
      have h₁₂ : ∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x)) := by
        intro x hx
        exact h₂ x hx
      -- We use the fact that the limit of S(x) as n → ∞ exists and is equal to g(x) for all x ∈ T.
      have h₁₃ : ∀ x ∈ T, ∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L) := by
        intro x hx
        exact h₁ x hx
      -- We use the fact that the limit of S(x) as n → ∞ exists and is equal to g(x) for all x ∈ T.
      have h₁₄ : ∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x)) := by
        intro x hx
        exact h₂ x hx
      -- We use the fact that the limit of S(x) as n → ∞ exists and is equal to g(x) for all x ∈ T.
      exact continuous_of_tendsto_nhds h₁₂
    exact h₁₁
  exact h₁₀
```

/--

-/
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T := by
  intro x hx
  intro h
  have h₁ := h.1
  have h₂ := h.2
  have h₃ := hx
  have h₄ := hS x hx
  have h₅ := h₂ x hx
  have h₆ := h₅
  have h₇ : ∀ n : ℕ, S x n = Real.exp 1 := by
    intro n
    induction n <;> simp_all [Real.logb, Real.exp_eq_exp]
    <;> field_simp [Real.exp_ne_zero] at *
    <;> linarith
  have h₈ : Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (Real.exp 1)) := by
    simp_all [tendsto_const_nhds]
  have h₉ : ContinuousOn g T := by
    apply continuousOn_const
  exact h₉
```

/--

-/
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T := by
  intro x hx h
  have h₁ := h.1
  have h₂ := h.2
  have h₃ := hS x hx
  have h₄ : ∀ n : ℕ, S x n = Real.exp 1 := by
    intro n
    induction n with
    | zero => simp_all
    | succ n ih =>
      simp_all [Real.logb, Real.exp_ne_zero]
      <;> field_simp [Real.exp_ne_zero] at *
      <;> linarith [Real.exp_pos 1]
  have h₅ : Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (Real.exp 1)) := by
    rw [show S x = fun n => Real.exp 1 by
      funext n
      rw [h₄ n]
    ]
    apply tendsto_const_nhds
  simp_all
  <;> aesop
```

-/

(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T := by
  intro x hx
  intro h
  have h₁ := h.1
  have h₂ := h.2
  have h₃ := h₂ x hx
  have h₄ := h₂
  have h₅ := h₁
  have h₆ := hS x hx
  have h₇ : ∀ n : ℕ, S x n = if n = 0 then Real.exp 1 else Real.logb (S x (n - 1)) x := by
    intro n
    cases n with
    | zero => simp_all [hS]
    | succ n => simp_all [hS, Nat.succ_eq_add_one, Nat.add_sub_cancel]
  have h₈ : ∀ n : ℕ, S x n = if n = 0 then Real.exp 1 else Real.logb (S x (n - 1)) x := by
    intro n
    cases n with
    | zero => simp_all [hS]
    | succ n => simp_all [hS, Nat.succ_eq_add_one, Nat.add_sub_cancel]
  have h₉ : ContinuousOn g T := by
    apply continuousOn_const
  exact h₉
```

open Set Function Filter Topology Polynomial Real

/--
For all $x > e^e$, let $S = u_0, u_1, \dots$ be a recursively defined sequence with $u_0 = e$ and $u_{n+1} = \log_{u_n} x$ for all $n \ge 0$. Prove that $S_x$ converges to some real number $g(x)$ and that this function $g$ is continuous for $x > e^e$.
-/
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1982_b5
(T : Set ℝ)
(hT : T = Ioi (Real.exp (Real.exp 1)))
(S : ℝ → ℕ → ℝ)
(hS : ∀ x ∈ T, S x 0 = (Real.exp 1) ∧ ∀ n : ℕ, S x (n + 1) = Real.logb (S x n) x)
(g : ℝ → ℝ)
: ∀ x ∈ T, (∃ L : ℝ, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 L)) ∧
(∀ x ∈ T, Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (g x))) → ContinuousOn g T := by
  intro x hx h
  have h₁ := h.1
  have h₂ := h.2
  have h₃ := hx
  have h₄ : x > Real.exp (Real.exp 1) := by simp_all [hT]
  have h₅ : ∀ n : ℕ, S x n = Real.exp 1 := by
    intro n
    induction n with
    | zero =>
      have h₆ := hS x hx
      simp_all [hS]
    | succ n ih =>
      have h₆ := hS x hx
      simp_all [hS, Real.logb, Real.exp_pos]
      <;> field_simp [Real.exp_ne_zero] at *
      <;> linarith
  have h₆ : Tendsto (S x) atTop (𝓝 (Real.exp 1)) := by
    rw [show S x = fun n => Real.exp 1 by
      ext n
      rw [h₅ n]
    ]
    apply tendsto_const_nhds
  simp_all [hT]
  <;> aesop
```
